abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the project were as
            follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. The main lesson of this project is that the
            Bank can play a productive role in providing support in
            urgent operations dealing with post-conflict situations,
            provided there is a pragmatic approach to the issues at
            hand. The success of the Kosovo Urgent Road Project can be
            explained by: (i) the simplicity of the project, which
            focused on the indispensable capacity needed in the public
            and private sectors to keep the operability of the road
            network; and (ii) the willingness of the Bank to adapt the
            requirements of project preparation to the urgency of the
            project, accepting the trade-offs between short lead-times
            and limited data gathering and background studies. This was
            done with the knowledge that the recommended actions would
            not be substantially changed if there would have been time
            for extensive preparation. The project highlights the
            importance of the long term efforts necessary to achieve
            lasting improvements in institutional performance, the more
            so when those improvements are not limited to technical
            know-how but involve a profound revision of cultural mores.

            ROAD PROJECT,TF030319-FRENCH CTF FOR EXPERTISE FY03 - BALKANS,TF039841-YUGOSLAVIA - KOSOVO:EMERGENCY

5086899.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Rural development,Urban development,Social dev/gender/inclusion

abstracts.cdata!:
The Kosovo Urgent Road Project, is
            inscribed within a comprehensive program of interventions in
            the road sector, and will primarily contribute to the
            post-conflict reconstruction, and economic development in
            the region, by supporting the re-establishment of a road
            management capacity, and, emergency road maintenance
            activities to restore the main road network. The three main
            components will: 1) provide funding for road maintenance, on
            those sections of the main network not requiring
            rehabilitation, but in need of maintenance to remain
            serviceable. Maintenance works will cover approximately
            1,500 km of the main network, and will include treatment of
            potholes, surface dressing, cleaning of drainage systems,
            and road signaling, to restore traffic safety; 2) perform
            road rehabilitation activities, on approximately 150 km of
            the main network, and will include restoration of
            culverts/drainage systems, overlays. Only a selective
            emergency reconstruction will be performed, on those
            sections almost destructed, given the scarce availability of
            funds. Overlay works will be performed on a high priority
            stretch of the Pristina-Gnjilane road; and, 3) support the
            re-establishment of a core road management capacity in
            Kosovo, providing technical assistance to the Directorate of
            Roads, in road maintenance, capacity building, and project implementation.
